context: God gives us the record of how the Syrians had successfully besieged the city of Samaria.
we enter into the 7th chapter of the book of 2 Kings and in chapter number 7 the text reveals to us, it starts with this great prophecy from Elisha
and the people went out and spoiled the tents of the Syrians. So a measure of fine flour was sold for a shekel and two measures of barley for a shekel according to the word of the Lord.
Elisha prophesies that a measure of fine flour will be sold for a shekel and two measures of barley for a shekel in the gate of Samaria.
The prophecy is fulfilled as a measure of fine flour is sold for a shekel and two measures of barley for a shekel, according to the word of the Lord.
The people trod upon him in the gate, and he died, as the man of God had said, who spake when the king came down to him.
behold, if the Lord should make windows in heaven, might such a thing be. And he, that's Elisha, said unto this servant, behold, thou shalt see it with thine eyes, but shalt not eat thereof.
The Bible tells us in v. 33, and while He yet talked with them, behold, the messenger came down unto Him and He said, behold, this evil is of the Lord. What should I wait for the Lord any longer?
